website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking to save money yet still pick up a crab pot that looks and cooks well, consider this option.
pros: Constructed of porcelain enamel over a steel core
Porcelain surface is nonstick and easy to clean
Works really well over an open fire
Nice look at a very affordable price
cons: Some edges can be sharp, particularly around the handles and the underside of the top
Some buyers claim the enamel can easily chip or wear off

customer_reviews.title: They can held up great over intense heat
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3 of these pots on top of the one I already owned. Cooked a clambake for 125 people over an open fire with these pots. They held up great over intense heat. Highly recommend these pots.
customer_reviews.author: poloclub1919

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for a deer mount
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 21 quart pot for boiling a 2x2 (13") mule deer mount and so far it has worked out great. The mount fits perfectly, with room to spare, and has held up to countless hours of high BTUs without any indication of wear. I highly recommend this product for this use.
customer_reviews.author: Cub

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this pot! I used it to make a massive pot of broth.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Great turkey brine pot
customer_reviews.text: I needed this to brine a large turkey. It worked perfectly. Due to the large size it doesn't fit in my sink too well so it's a little difficult to wash. Although hard to fit in the sink to wash, it's not the product's fault. I ordered a very large stock pot for a reason and it was up to the task.
customer_reviews.author: Gunny

customer_reviews.title: Huge but awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome pot. However it's freaking huge lol. Barely fit on my glass electric stovetop. But it does! Boil chicken in bulk for the dogs. Probably larger than I needed but it's cool anyway. To the people who burn sauce and food. Duh, feel how thin it is. It heats very quickly. Don't burn something because you can't cook and then blame it on the pot. I'll update my review after a bunch of uses to comment on the lasting quality
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Came in great condition! Using it for natural dying and does a great job!
customer_reviews.author: Genesis

customer_reviews.title: Had Some Type of Smell
customer_reviews.text: Did not even use it yet, washed it and it started exuding some type of smell which I did not want to deal with. So, I returned it. I love the new return process where you can take you item to Kohls and get a discount for use in their store. I do not shop at Kohls, but I love seeing the face of strangers when I give them a 25% off coupon for no reason other than, I can. Great idea, Amazon and Kohls.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Great pot!!
customer_reviews.text: Loved the size of pot and used it for fabulous mashed potatoes on Thanksgiving! So the reason for a 4 rating. The handles seem a little sharp when handling when pot is fairly full. Make sure you use pot holders when carrying! Glad we bought!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Huge, being measurement challenged wasn't expecting so big but love it
customer_reviews.text: Works great for making soup, holds lots of veges and meat etc get enough that I can freeze some for lunches and still have plenty for meals. I don't fill it all the way but much nicer than my small big pot using before.
customer_reviews.author: dudiesmom

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: awesome for our home lobster bake! Fit 10 lobster in here no problem!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bobo81

customer_reviews.title: Every home needs one
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of cooking crabs this was the pot i needed to cook the amount of crabs i am accustomed to eating. Pour the beer in there and you are good to go. Great buy and a great price
customer_reviews.author: Durrell gresham

customer_reviews.title: Giant on my burner
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet but I thought it would be tall and skinnier....I have used other products b4 made of same material and have no problems. I needed a giant stock pot. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: KarleighMegan

customer_reviews.title: Granite Ware 34 qt stock pot
customer_reviews.text: The pot actually came a couple of days sooner than they said it would and was in great shape. I bought it to use when canning tomatoes and put it to work right away. It fits over two burners and is tall enough to put plenty of water in it, no worry of it boiling out! Love it, thinking about ordering another.
customer_reviews.author: Penny

customer_reviews.title: Best pot ever!
customer_reviews.text: The pot was big and cooked my greens in half the time that it would have with a regular size pot.
customer_reviews.author: doris Newby McFadden

customer_reviews.title: The pot was damaged
customer_reviews.text: We really like the pot but the enamel chipped on the inside and the outside. The inside after one use. The outside cane chipped from the shipping. I think I need to return it. Have you had this problem with the pot before?
customer_reviews.author: donna

customer_reviews.title: decent, economical
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for home brewing beer. The price was lower than other aluminum pots, and it's big enough to boil 6 gallons of wort without too much boil over. The only downside so far is that the inside bottom is starting to chip a bit, and I'm worried it may affect taste. But it served as an econimcal way to get into full-boil extract brewing. Glad I bought it, but may need to replace in the next year or so.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A. Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Great for heating water
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as hot liqour tank for brewing. I basically only heat water in it. It works great for that. I have noticed the occasional, tiny chip floating around while heating water, but I haven't noticed any corrosion or any other ill-effects yet. I just wish I had looked around for them locally. After receiving this one from Amazon I saw the exact same one for $5 less at Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B Kulp

customer_reviews.title: Sticks
customer_reviews.text: Everything I have tried to cook sticks to the bottom of the pan unfortunately. I have gas heat and really don't cook anything on high so I am unsure why it sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Whiting

customer_reviews.title: A backyard sugaring dream
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot. It is *huge*...perfect for boiling maple sap into syrup.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Kreider

customer_reviews.title: Thin and tinny, but holds a lot of wort
customer_reviews.text: I got this for brewing full 5 gallon batches of beer. It works well for that, being about the biggest post I could reliably fit on my stove. Being a bit wide rather than super tall, it's a little easier to work under the stove hood for stirring, etc. But if you fill this thing up, prepare for a hernia if you try to move it around. You're talking about 50 pounds or more, here.
customer_reviews.author: RantyTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: ... use the pot for homebrewing beer and it works great. I can do full 5 gallon boils with ...
customer_reviews.text: I use the pot for homebrewing beer and it works great. I can do full 5 gallon boils with plenty of room and not have to worry much about boil overs.
customer_reviews.author: amanda C

customer_reviews.title: Pot
customer_reviews.text: This pot is great I make a lot of soups for my family and this is perfect for that.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: great collards cooking pot
customer_reviews.text: got this pot for my mother-in-law she loves it as it is the best large pot she ever owned
customer_reviews.author: R. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my huge pot!
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to receive my pot! Product is in great condition. It is huge! I love it so far. Just finished my greens and string beans in it!!! Made cookinf my smoked meat a breeze. 1st day, so I will update after couple of weeks. So far so great!
customer_reviews.author: Melody C.

customer_reviews.title: Lobster pot .
customer_reviews.text: Though I originally intended it to be for a lobster pot for my girlfriends birthday - I will also use it for holidays and to make my infamous chilli from time to time .
customer_reviews.author: Shea Hembree

customer_reviews.title: Granite material at base disintigrated in high heat
customer_reviews.text: Somehow the base disintegrated and got micro chips of the granite melted to my stovetop, and might have made it all the way through the pot to the batch of salsa i was making.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Iriarte

customer_reviews.title: Had to return the stockpot...
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this item as there were chipped places all over the pot and the lid was a little bent and didn't sit flat on the pot. Decided to go the good all stainless steel instead
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Barnett

customer_reviews.title: stock pot
customer_reviews.text: This stock pot is much bigger than i expected. but love it
customer_reviews.author: Tonia Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great for Clothes Dyeing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for dying clothes and it's perfect for it. I think that simmering clothes especially darks is better than washing machine dyeing.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy S

customer_reviews.title: Great product and shipping packing was excellent
customer_reviews.text: For the price it'sworth every penny! I will refer this to anyone who need a large pot! Great product and shipping packing was excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: My Best Buy.
customer_reviews.text: My grandma made gumbo in this pot. A week later I boiled crab legs, shrimp, sausages and corn in this pot for five people. It’s the perfect pot. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: TaShaya

customer_reviews.title: Damaged/Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is how it was when I opened the box. Extremely disappointed that it isn’t more sturdy. It either didn’t make it through ups like it was supposed to or it actually got sent to me this way!!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive pot
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my first home brew. Worked great. Be careful not to turn the burner up to high so the bottom does not scorch. It is thin but works well so long as you pay attention.
customer_reviews.author: Kestas Parakininkas

customer_reviews.title: cooks great, great
customer_reviews.text: Could only find this on Amazon, cooks great, great price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The lid had been dropped at some time, the porcelain is broken off whete the lid dented.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Timely Arrival but Broken
customer_reviews.text: Pot arrived today, but had a large chip on the bottom, inside and out. Cheap construction. I will be contactnng customer service. I will post again to report on how well that went.
customer_reviews.author: Karl F Scheibner

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: This is not a thick metal pot. It is very thin and easily bends and chips. Same quality as any $10 stock pot. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Chickenlegs

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This pot was perfect size exactly what I expected!! Huge!!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Baker

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done as a brew pot.
customer_reviews.text: Bargain substitute for the expensive stainless pots that people use to brew beer. The enamel finish is non-reactive, works fine for beer. Not as nice as a heavy stainless pot, but less expensive, well made, and quite functional.
customer_reviews.author: GBinGA

customer_reviews.title: Great gumbo !
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this pot. I was using 3 smaller pots to make my gumbos, but instead I now use this pot. It is just perfect and I'm definitely happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dumestre

customer_reviews.title: lobster pot
customer_reviews.text: we cooked 10 lobsters in the boiling water pot for 20 minutes and they came out just right. the pot cleaned nicely and ready for the next seafood cookout.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: It's big
customer_reviews.text: Great no we can make ham and cabbage in one put.
customer_reviews.author: george major

customer_reviews.title: My preferred pot for home brewing
customer_reviews.text: My preferred pot for home brewing because of the size, cost, ease of cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: the size of the pot i love but its not very thick .... feels and sound flimsy
customer_reviews.author: malika dupres

customer_reviews.title: can double as a baby bath
customer_reviews.text: can cook up to 8 lobsters at a time.. we did it on christmas eve.. real heavy with water though
customer_reviews.author: G. Guarino

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Product is as described. Used to to book sap into syrup over a fire.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Needed a large pot for cooking large amounts of homemade dog food. Of course I didn't want to pay the ridiculous price being charge by others for a 20 quart. This pot however fits the bill. It holds a large amount of food; holds heat well; and was fairly priced.
customer_reviews.author: Terence Davis

customer_reviews.title: Mean Greens
customer_reviews.text: I cooked a mean pot of greens for Thanksgiving. This held 12 bushels plus some. I had 24 bushels to pick and clean. I love it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Peaches

customer_reviews.title: VERY large pot
customer_reviews.text: This pot is HUGE, and it can easily fit over a half a dozen lobsters in it with no problem whatsoever. It takes up a full third of my stove-top as well. Just an FYI.
customer_reviews.author: The weatherman

customer_reviews.title: 5 gal brew pot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pot to brew beer. When it arrived it was so thin I thought it would fall apart the first time I used it. I certainly thought the handles would come off if I tried to lift a full pot with them. I was surprised. It is a lot tougher than it looks. It is not ideal for brewing, (it is to short and wide) but is a big inexpensive pot.
customer_reviews.author: Lister of Smeg

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great. I'll most likely purchase other sizes and configurations as well.
customer_reviews.author: N.B.

customer_reviews.title: Enamel chips
customer_reviews.text: This pot came out of the box with large pieces of the enamel chipping off, both inside and outside the pot. No longer safe for cooking and I haven't used it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A. Outhouse

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: FROM CLAM BAKES TO STEW , BIG ENOUGHT TO FEED THE WHOLE TROOP
customer_reviews.author: andy weatherly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my corned beef & cabbage party!
customer_reviews.text: Large enough for lobsters but also (if having a large gathering) for Italian sauce, stews, soups or my famous corned beef & cabbage!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Working well.
customer_reviews.text: This was used for canning 2quart jars of apple cider. Worked well. It is very heavy with warer in it and must be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A Hubin

customer_reviews.title: Cheap pot, arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: Well it's a cheap stock pot, I bought it for brewing. It had a decent sized dent/gash on the bottom when it arrived. Box was intact, so it left the warehouse this way. Not too happy about that, but we're working on getting it replaced through Amazon, so we'll see.
customer_reviews.author: David C. Grow

customer_reviews.title: Sharp Lid!
customer_reviews.text: I returned this pot. The metal on the lid -- where it is turned back against the lid top all the way around -- was not finished smoothly. I scraped my fingers. If I had been holding it more firmly, I could have been seriously cut. Perhaps it was just this pot, but now I do not trust the quality. If you have this pot, you might want to check this. Mine was as sharp as a rasp or saw blade.
customer_reviews.author: Tryphena Bell

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this pot! It's huge...we fit 3 2.5 pounders in there with a ton of room to spare!
customer_reviews.author: LisaMHale

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic pot for stocks
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding buy. I really like Granite Ware for its simplicity to handle and clean. Very lightweight and durable. Do not use excess temperatures and it should last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: TerriH

customer_reviews.title: Veer big and holds a great amount of liquid
customer_reviews.text: Veer big and holds a great amount of liquid. Great for making soup or stew. Also great for boiling a chicken or veggies, enough for a big family. Very thick and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: MV

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: This pot is huge and great for cooking lobsters. I cooked 4 large lobsters in the pot and it was great. Pot can be used for canning if anyone still cans things. Would be great for a large gumbo to be cooked in.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Sellers Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: I had to return this item, because I could ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this item, because I could not use it on my glass top burners. It has a label on it that says this.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda mccarley

customer_reviews.title: big as pot
customer_reviews.text: crazy big pot - no clue why i needed it but got it now ! have yet to use it. nothing fancy just huge
customer_reviews.author: slacker

customer_reviews.title: Pot size
customer_reviews.text: Pot itself is fine. However, we did not see a height notation before the purchase. We are having to pull all shelves out of the oven and sit the pot on the bottom to make our chex mix recipe
customer_reviews.author: Victor Grantham

customer_reviews.title: It was going to start burning and smell like it was burning
customer_reviews.text: When I used the pots for cooking purposes to make a soup it was sticking to the pot. When I realize that I turned the flame down on low. It was going to start burning and smell like it was burning . At that point I no longer wanted my food to smell burnt. I turned by turn the pot off
customer_reviews.author: lennette

customer_reviews.title: Defective Pot
customer_reviews.text: Defective pot Receieved product in a timely fashion, then upon removing sticker on front of the pot, noticed another sticker half ripped behind the new label. Upon further inspection, noticed a blemish on bottom corner of pot, inside it was damaged at the same location as if somehow it was dropped on edge. Someone else prior purchasing the pot must have returned it for the same defect. No problem, just wrap it up again and waste another customers time by sending it out defective pot. What a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Rob G.

customer_reviews.title: Big pot, horrible quality
customer_reviews.text: I was desperate to find a pot large enough to dye a costume and both time and budget very short. This pot was cheap enough but it was never suggested it was a "second" or defective in any way. Enamel chipping both inside and outside. Cut my finger on an enamel piece hanging off of it. Will have to use it. Time too short. I would NEVER use this pot as something, especially food prep, to be relied upon.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Hersh

customer_reviews.title: Good pot. More detail needed!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to steam crabs. WIll only fit about 9 to 10 crabs inside of it. Great product, simply wish the description was a little bit more detailed.
customer_reviews.author: TFack

customer_reviews.title: good enough
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pot for brewing beer. I wish I would've gotten something smaller for the five gallon batches that I'm making.
customer_reviews.author: Waldo Finney

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: ordered original came -damaged-porcelin chipped=returned second one inside large chip-went to Macys and found perfect products-must be damaged in handling-pass on this item
customer_reviews.author: Carl  B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Very good stock pot. fills the bill for what I wanted. blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah double blah
customer_reviews.author: Robert H. McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Horrible, first time I used the pot it burned my boyfriend sauce in a matter of 10 minutes. highly disappointed I can't return it.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Agnello

customer_reviews.title: I would have given a 5 star rating,
customer_reviews.text: I would have given a 5 star rating ,but it did not come with handles on the sides for picking it up
customer_reviews.author: Robert Rohrig

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The most beautiful and good quality ! It arrives in perfect condition and fast delivery.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Nice and big!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for! I needed a really big pot that would cover my oval burner in the middle of my stove and haven't been able to find one until now. This is the perfect size for the water bath canning I'll be doing this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Kinsman

customer_reviews.title: Big Big Pot
customer_reviews.text: This pot is HUGE! You can cook a whole turkey in this thing! I just wanted it to boil crab legs and I had no idea it would be bigger than the eye on the stove but oh well. I can lay the crab legs flat so I’ll keep it!
customer_reviews.author: Kay Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Feed the crowd :)
customer_reviews.text: I like this pot a lot, I can easily cook Paprika-Gulasch for 50 people in there. Can't really brown anything in it but I got a separate nonstick-coated pan and just work in batches and add the browned meat to this awesome pot.
customer_reviews.author: Silvana

customer_reviews.title: Nice pot for cabbage stew or gulash (if you're making ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice pot for cabbage stew or gulash (if you're making it for like 60 peoples) Had it for almost 2 years no rust no nothing. I had to make chicken soup for my girls scouts one time...yo this pot handled it like a champ. I put 3 whole chickens into that bad boy. The best chicken soup ever, according to the girls. In fact one of the mothers on the girls scout troop said she gonna get the same jawn. I told her where I got it (amazon of course) and she bought it like tree days later.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Appolonius Southwind III

customer_reviews.title: Good size pot,good thick enamel coating.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing not great was the lid obviously had a dent in it before it was coated because the enamel was not chipped so it didn't happen in shipping, the dent is on the side of the lid and is a good 2" long and about 1" high, doesn't affect usage just not in prefect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Trina L.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for canning and making dairy products
customer_reviews.text: I make and teach cheese & yogurt classes. These pans are perfect to heat up milk. My only wish is they were a tad more sturdy and less prone to rust. Do not heat food in these on high heat due to scorch. After washing graniteware pans, dry very well or in time they do rust. This pan is great for a 5 gallon batch of milk with lots of room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Just MeTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: "I used it recently to do a giant low country boil, and the pot worked really well."
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot so far! I used it recently to do a giant low country boil, and the pot worked really well. It held all the food, took no damage from my gas stove, and was easy to clean despite its size.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Brumbeloe

customer_reviews.title: Lousy quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to fry a turkey for Thanksgiving. Did a test boil with just water prior to the big day. The enamel flaked off from the inside and was floating around in the boil. Enamel on my turkey is not acceptable so I returned it. Poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nc girl

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: had a large dent in the lid and enamel was gone..lots of other spots on lid
customer_reviews.author: Ruth A Sims

customer_reviews.title: NO goood
customer_reviews.text: No good!!!!!!!!this pan is too thin when filling the walls of the pan are deformed it loses its shape I would not recommend a purchase I do not like !!!
customer_reviews.author: Grigoriy

customer_reviews.title: ... Granite Ware pots - lightweight and can be cleaned easily without hard scrubbing
customer_reviews.text: Bought a lot of Granite Ware pots - lightweight and can be cleaned easily without hard scrubbing.
customer_reviews.author: CAF

customer_reviews.title: Received 2nd damaged pot despite intact packaging. Dents and enamel defects. Quality Control issue?
customer_reviews.text: The pot will be used only to brine my turkey. It is big enough for a large turkey. I might use it to make the stock for soup but so far I've returned 2 of 2 because of significant dents and enamel defects.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Ofstein MD

customer_reviews.title: Good Pot
customer_reviews.text: Worked for what I needed. A little thin on the walls.
customer_reviews.author: BabyBoom

customer_reviews.title: The bottom of this pot is NOT flat, it ...
customer_reviews.text: The bottom of this pot is NOT flat, it is made to fit over an electric coil burner. Due to this it heats incredibly slowly on a glass or induction cooktop.
customer_reviews.author: GreatScott!

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Love how huge it is... But enamelware chips way too easily...
customer_reviews.author: *Angel*

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like?!
customer_reviews.text: Hey, it's a pot! I wanted a pot! It does what pots do! What's not to like?!?
customer_reviews.author: Boudreaux

customer_reviews.title: The pot size was great but the material didn't seem too flattering
customer_reviews.text: The pot size was great but the material didn't seem too flattering. It felt too lightweight in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Jason and Brandy Rock

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Lobster pot for LARGE lobsters
customer_reviews.text: Great Lobster pot (that is the only thing I use it for as it is HUGE) can easily accommodate 3 large lobsters. Very heavy when full so wait until water cools to move it. (just a suggestion) unless you want to be the next McDonalds coffee caper person.
customer_reviews.author: MrsAsta

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of crabs fit in this one
customer_reviews.text: My 30 year old crab pot finally sprung a leak. It was a family heirloom and it was difficult to find a replacement that didn't cost $80+. This is perfect. The steamer rack fit great in the bottom and 1/2 bushel of blue crabs can be steamed in one batch. Bought the outside propane burner and this fits perfectly on that.
customer_reviews.author: C. Maranville

customer_reviews.title: Granite Ware stock pot
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for homebrewing. 34 quart size will be plenty big for 5 gal batches during stirring, steeping grains, etc. Appears to be good quality finish that should last a while. To be able to boil the whole wort was a big selling point to improve hop utilization. Cheers....
customer_reviews.author: Larbear

customer_reviews.title: Great for large family or a craw dad boil
customer_reviews.text: HUGE! Great for large family or a craw dad boil.
customer_reviews.author: Tomany 80's

customer_reviews.title: nice very large pot
customer_reviews.text: nice very large pot, i use it to boil down maple sap, its been on the turkey fryer burner for a few days no problems so far
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Enamel started chipping after second use
customer_reviews.text: I have had similar pots for years with no problems but this pot chipped after the second use. I don't know why this one did but I am very dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Enamel wore off bottom on first use
customer_reviews.text: While using this pot the enamel on the bottom of the pot began to chip off and float to the surface. Be wary when buying this pot. This happened on the very fist use. I would not recommend this pot for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: To make soups like pozole,and to use to prepare for tamales
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is a giant pot. Works well as a giant pot.
customer_reviews.author: Kane

product_meta.title: Granite Ware 34-Quart Stock Pot, Black
product_meta.description: Size:34 quartsA generous 34 quart size is great for seafood boils, and serving large groups. Porcelain is fused to the steel at 2,000 degrees Fahrenheit producing a non-porous, inert glass surface that is naturally non-stick. It’s non -porous so it won’t trap odors or food particles and provides a low coefficient of friction – meaning that it cleans up easily and, it is corrosion and chemically resistant so it will last a long time. This makes an ideal material for large pots as the glass-like surface is inert and does not interact with or alter the taste of food. The steel core is an excellent heat conductor, requiring less time and energy. No PFOA's or any other chemicals are used that may affect food taste, color or healthfulness. When fired, the vessel is placed on pins so the bottom and sides are hardened during the firing process into one smooth laminated glass surface. You may notice slight pin indentations where the glass has flowed around the pin that supports the base during firing. The pin marks do not compromise the finish or performance of the vessel. Porcelain can chip if dropped, however this does not reduce the effectiveness of the cookware. Not recommended for glass cooktops.
feature_bullets: Easy to clean porcelain enamel surface
Glass-like surface does not interact with food
